Key Match Events: Malik Monk recorded a game-high 31 points
Jaylen Wells scored 30 points for the Grizzlies
Jarren Jackson Jr. scored 28 points for the Grizzlies
The Kings led 78-72 at halftime and 102-100 after three quarters
The Grizzlies took a 110-109 lead on Scottie Pippen Jr.'s free throws with 7:56 left in the fourth quarter
The Kings went on a 20-10 run to regain the lead, culminating with a 3-pointer by Malik Monk with 4:21 remaining
Post-Match Reflections: De’Aaron Fox led the Kings with 23 points
Ja Morant and Marcus Smart did not play due to injuries
Keegan Murray missed his second straight game due to a left ankle injury
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zach Edey returned from a two-game absence due to a concussion and had nine points and seven rebounds off the bench
Kings guard Devin Carter, the son of Grizzlies assistant coach Anthony Carter, made his debut with the team in the first quarter
The teams combined for 150 points in the first half
The Kings made 29 of 59 shots from the field (52.7%) while the Grizzlies knocked down 26 of 50 shots (52%)
The teams made 17 3-pointers combined in the first quarter, with the Kings making 10 of 18 and the Grizzlies making 7 of 11
